sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The simutime function returns the number of simulated time units that have passed since program execution began.
sections.mdown_content: The **simutime** function returns the number of simulated time units that have passed since program execution began.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: Simulated time only passes when all process are either paused or waiting. This simulates the fact that CPU time is effectively infinitely fast when compared to "pause" time.
sections.mdown_content: Simulated time only passes when all process are either paused or waiting. This simulates the fact that CPU time is effectively infinitely fast when compared to "pause" time.

sections.title: Example
code:
process p (t : int)
            loop
                pause t
                put simutime
            end loop
        end p
        
        fork p (3)
        fork p (5)
sections.raw_content: This prints out the simulated time passing between two processes. This will print out 3, 5, 6, 9, 10, 12, 15, 15, 18, 20, 21, …
sections.mdown_content: This prints out the simulated time passing between two processes. This will print out *3*,* 5*,* 6*,* 9*,* 10*,* 12*,* 15*,* 15*,* 18*,* 20*,* 21*,* Â…*
